channel.title: Will someone explain this line of code to me?

item.title: Will someone explain this line of code to me?
item.dc:creator: @cardguydude cardguydude
item.description:
@cardguydude wrote:

I had a kid get my client before i obfuscated it, he edited my code to change his username somehow, like to where it shows up as another user. Thats why i want the click ban option and not by name.

Read full topic
item.source: Will someone explain this line of code to me?

item.title: Will someone explain this line of code to me?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“cardguydude, post:5, topic:435288”][quote author=austinsobes link=topic=538008.msg3935195#msg3935195 date=1331001606]

Well, where would i edit what the trade button does?
[/quote]lolwut?

And also, it not’s what it does for a null. Specifically, it does stuff if it’s NOT a null. Anyways.

To me, this looks like a general option selector. Not an expert in RSPS, or even close. but it looks like option buttons are sent here to be evaluated or display/set. The ‘null’ reference Daginith was referring to was validation. If these expressions !=(Are not) null, then do this.

I replaced my follow button with a ban button for myself only. I want to know how to make the ban button ban.[/quote]
Tbh, why is this needed? I can see you going like “Oh let me attack thi --O fuck, i banned him!” just use the ::ban. Way easier.

Read full topic

item.title: Will someone explain this line of code to me?
item.dc:creator: @cardguydude cardguydude
item.description:
@cardguydude wrote:

public String optionType = "null"; public void showOption(int i, int l, String s, int a) { //synchronized(c) { if(c.getOutStream() != null && c != null) { if(!optionType.equalsIgnoreCase(s)) { optionType = s; c.getOutStream().createFrameVarSize(104); c.getOutStream().writeByteC(i); c.getOutStream().writeByteA(l); c.getOutStream().writeString(s); c.getOutStream().endFrameVarSize(); c.flushOutStream(); } }

Read full topic
